snippet: The Pakistani military command said it had attacked six targets in the Shawal Valley of North Waziristan and killed 27 militant fighters.
abstract: Pakistani commanders promise crushing blow to jihadi groups that have flourished in tribal district of North Waziristan as full military offensive takes shape; military has vowed to disrupt all militant sanctuaries, including those of the Taliban, Al Qaeda and the Haqqani network.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Zia ur-Rehman and Saba Imtiaz from Karachi, Pakistan; Ismail Khan and Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud from Peshawar, Pakistan; and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The Pakistani military command said it had attacked six targets in the Shawal Valley of North Waziristan and killed 27 militant fighters.

headline.main: In Drive Against Militants, Pakistani Airstrikes Hit Strongholds
headline.print_headline: In Drive Against Militants, Pakistani Airstrikes Hit Strongholds
